docs.lead_paragraph: Women's vulnerability to disasters is a sign not of weakness but of inequality, and barriers to women taking the lead in protecting themselves must be removed, top politicians and officials told a U.N. conference on Saturday.

headline.main: How to Make Women Safer in Disasters? Attack Inequality
headline.print_headline: How to Make Women Safer in Disasters? Attack Inequality

docs.snippet: Women's vulnerability to disasters is a sign not of weakness but of inequality, and barriers to women taking the lead in protecting themselves must be removed, top politicians and officials told a U.N. conference on Saturday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Scott Walker's rivals see him as an up-and-comer in the Republican race for president, so they are focusing on the Wisconsin governor's changing positions on a number of issues.

headline.main: Walker Draws Scrutiny From GOP Rivals for Changing Positions
headline.print_headline: Walker Draws Scrutiny From GOP Rivals for Changing Positions

docs.snippet: Scott Walker's rivals see him as an up-and-comer in the Republican race for president, so they are focusing on the Wisconsin governor's changing positions on a number of issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leigh Castergine, a former senior vice president for ticket sales, and the Mets resolved the case on Friday, with no terms disclosed.

headline.main: Mets Resolve Suit With Executive They Fired When She Was Pregnant and Unmarried
headline.print_headline: Mets Resolve Suit With Executive They Fired When She Was Pregnant and Unmarried

docs.abstract: New York Mets resolve lawsuit with Leigh Castergine, former senior vice president for ticket sales, with no terms discussed; Castergine alleged she was fired because she complained about discriminatory treatment over her pregnancy to team's human resources department.
docs.snippet: Leigh Castergine, a former senior vice president for ticket sales, and the Mets resolved the case on Friday, with no terms disclosed.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican-led Iowa House voted on Thursday to require doctors to perform an ultrasound on any woman seeking an abortion and let her see the image and hear the fetus' heartbeat.

headline.main: Iowa House Passes Bill Requiring Ultrasound Before Abortion
headline.print_headline: Iowa House Passes Bill Requiring Ultrasound Before Abortion

docs.snippet: The Republican-led Iowa House voted on Thursday to require doctors to perform an ultrasound on any woman seeking an abortion and let her see the image and hear the fetus' heartbeat.

docs.abstract: Social marginalization and mistrust of modern medicine have caused high infant mortality rates among indigenous communities in Bolivia. Efforts over the last 10 years seek to stem the crisis while respecting traditions.
docs.snippet: Social marginalization and mistrust of modern medicine have caused high infant mortality rates among indigenous communities in Bolivia. Efforts over the last 10 years seek to stem the crisis while respecting traditions.

docs.lead_paragraph: Giving birth to her first child — and watching her husband tend to their daughter — made Kelly Clarkson realize how much her father wasn't around when she was growing up.

headline.main: Motherhood Hits Home for Kelly Clarkson, in Life and Music
headline.print_headline: Motherhood Hits Home for Kelly Clarkson, in Life and Music

docs.snippet: Giving birth to her first child — and watching her husband tend to their daughter — made Kelly Clarkson realize how much her father wasn't around when she was growing up.

headline.main: Unraveling the Church Ban on Gay Sex

docs.abstract: The time has come for the Roman Catholic Church to rethink its claim that homosexual behavior is immoral. Here’s how.
docs.snippet: The time has come for the Roman Catholic Church to rethink its claim that homosexual behavior is immoral. Here’s how.

docs.lead_paragraph: Fifty years ago, Daniel Patrick Moynihan argued presciently that the rise of single-parent households would make poverty more intractable. Have we learned anything since?
docs.abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column analyzes long failure by liberals to embrace important research by Daniel Patrick Moynihan and successors who tied rise of single-parent households to intractable poverty; holds aversion to the appearance of racism has prevented liberals from seeing simple fact that broken homes present enormous disadvantages to children of any color; calls for initiatives to boost prospects for poor families and to delay childbearing in young women.
docs.snippet: Fifty years ago, Daniel Patrick Moynihan argued presciently that the rise of single-parent households would make poverty more intractable. Have we learned anything since?

docs.lead_paragraph: RTE, Ireland’s national broadcaster, held a contest searching for the country’s favorite poem of the past century, and a Seamus Heaney work won.

headline.main: Seamus Heaney Work Wins Contest Honoring Ireland’s Poets and Its Past
headline.print_headline: A Contest Honors Ireland’s Poets and Past

docs.abstract: Seamus Heaney's When all the others were away at Mass wins title of Ireland's best-loved poem in contest created by national broadcaster RTE to rekindle interest in literary art form that was once held an almost holy place in nation's culture.
docs.snippet: RTE, Ireland’s national broadcaster, held a contest searching for the country’s favorite poem of the past century, and a Seamus Heaney work won.

docs.lead_paragraph: A New York hospital anesthesiologist charged with choking an acquaintance and forcing her to swallow a pill that could cause an abortion has pleaded guilty to harassment.

headline.main: Doctor Pleads Guilty to Reduced Charge in Abortion Pill Case
headline.print_headline: Doctor Pleads Guilty to Reduced Charge in Abortion Pill Case

docs.snippet: A New York hospital anesthesiologist charged with choking an acquaintance and forcing her to swallow a pill that could cause an abortion has pleaded guilty to harassment.
